description: From Middle English ajournen, from Old French ajorner (French ajourner), from the phrase a jor (nom√©) ("to an (appointed) day").

verbs.description: adjourn (third-person singular simple present adjourns, present participle adjourning, simple past and past participle adjourned)

examples: The trial was adjourned for a week.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To defer; to put off temporarily or indefinitely.
(intransitive) To end or suspend an event.
examples: The court will adjourn for lunch.

entries.meaning: (intransitive, formal, uncommon) To move as a group from one place to another.
examples: After the dinner, we will adjourn to the bar.
